document.docAuthor: Rizzo, Alexandra E. & Salazar-Vallejo, Sergio I.
document.masterDocTitle: Hesionidae Grube, 1850 (Annelida: Polychaeta) from South-Southeastern Brazil, with descriptions of four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Hesionidae Grube, 1850 (Annelida: Polychaeta) from South-Southeastern Brazil, with descriptions of four new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species
:
Oxydromus fasciatus
Grube, 1855
, by monotypy.

Remarks.
Villalobos-Guerrero & Harris ( 2012 )
have reinstated
Oxydromus
over
Ophiodromus
because the former was erroneously regarded a junior homonym of
Oxydromus Schlegel, 1854
(Aves, Gruiformes , Rallidae ), which was an incorrect subsequent spelling of
Ocydromus Wagler, 1830
.

1 )
Oxydromus aucklandicus Willey, 1902
and
O . viridescens
(Ehlers, 1864 )
are incompletely described and cannot be inserted in key.
Gyptis incompta
Ehlers, 1913
(not
1912
which is a nomen nudum fide Hartman 1964 ) is listed under
Oxydromus
in WoRMS but it belongs in
Gyptis
.
2 )
Ophiodromus longocirratus
Tenerelli, 1973
is a 2 mm long juvenile, perhaps of a Mediterranean
Gyptis
species.
